Because they thought it would be funny to experiment on Mordekaiser (the Master of Metal, a lich king, warlock and warrior who summons the souls of his defeated enemies/allies to do his bidding) and send him botlane with a support (or to go 2 mid as CertainlyT said).
Even after more than a year, they didn't officially said "yea we're sorry" and it hurts. :'(
Now, on to serious business: playing him botlane works IF the enemy hasn't too much poke/tankiness and IF your support knows how Mordekaiser works. This never happens unless you play with a friend or if you're not low elo (unlike me :'( ).
Top lane he shits on the likes of Riven and Yasuo because they want to trade with you but don't realize it doesn't work.
For the builds, since he scales off of too many things, you can go full ap, full tank or in between. The best is to go in between toplane and full ap botlane (or mid if you're into that). Full tank is kind of a waste since you don't have cc, so you won't do anything for your team (no damage and 0 utility. Yes, the W heal isn't an utility if you play tank).

So do I build ANY tank items in the build or just go 5 AP items and Sorc Boots? Doesn't look like you need CDR (don't see it in builds)?

I like the idea of an AP kick-ass top laner. I play a lot of Vladimir but I expect Morde can bully way harder against melee.  

Sounds like he's a situational pick (if you've got engage tanks/fighters in other lanes). Ghost + Stormraiders top a good combination? 

Also, can he deal with Fiora?

CDR is very important, it's just hard to get in the items that Morde likes. You don't want Morello because it has Mana, you don't want to freeze yourself with a Zhonya when you're already so slow, etc. But since your durability is linked to the damage you deal with your spells, more CDR means more damage and more shield, so it's really a good stat to have. Getting your E back .5 s earlier and get 50% shield from it can often be the difference between life and death.

I also disagree with the previous post that says you can go anything from full AP to full Tank. Full Tank is horrible, you need at least 2 damage items in a full build. But you should consider some Tank items, especially if the enemy team is also tanky and you can't hope to burst them. Good items to consider are: Spirit Visage, for the increased healing on your W + CDR, Deadman for the movespeed+slow it gives. You can also opt-in for any of the MR+10% CDR if you situationally need them, including Abyssal since you deal mostly Magic damage.

All the hybrid AP/Defense items are also interesting, especially since most of them also give CDR. Protobelt is HP+Mobility, Banshee is MR+a spell shield that can block a critical CC and let you engage, Zhonya is a bit less enticing but still decent in some situation. Rylai/Liandry also have a decent amount of HP and good synergy with your kit.

Also, don't forget Sterak and Gunblade, you have decent AD ratios, and the highest base AD in the whole game, so you can actually benefit quite a lot from those 2 items. (I've also seen people going for a Trifroce once in a while, since it also works from base AD, but I personally would not recommend that, it's a super niche item for Morde.)

Dude, I suggest you start playing with him before asking for advices because it would take a long time ^^
Don't rush things and take your time,you'll be able to identify his strength and weaknesses. It would also make you a better player if you discover most of these by yourself instead of getting all the work done for you because you'll be closed in a box.

But more generally,he is an excellent pick when your frontlane has huge CC. Otherwise,it'll be quite complicated to reach your target ,but not impossible.you can kite him easily (you'll discover it by yourself).
